name: prettify-symbols-mode
description: Displays identifiers & symbols using more aesthetically pleasing symbols.

prettifySymbolsMode.revealOn.description: When to reveal the original text. Options are -- 'cursor': reveal when a cursor contacts a symbol; 'cursor-inside': reveal when a cursor is inside a symbol; 'active-line': reveal all symbols on the same line as a cursor; 'selection': reveal all symbols that are selected or contact a cursor; 'none': do not reveal. This option may be overriden per-language by specifying 'revealOn' in a language entry.

prettifySymbolsMode.adjustCursorMovement.description: If enabled, cursor movement will treat 'pretty' symbols as one character instead of stepping through the underlying 'ugly' text (this does not currently cover all situations). This option may be overriden per-language by specifying 'adjustCursorMovement' in a language entry.

prettifySymbolsMode.prettyCursor.description: Controls how a 'pretty' symbol is rendered when contacted by a cursor. Options are -- 'boxed': render an outline around the symbol; 'none': no change. This option may be overriden per-language by specifying 'prettyCursor' in a language entry.

prettifySymbolsMode.substitutions.description: A list of substitution settings can be specified for each language.

language.description: A pattern, or list of patterns, to specify which languages to apply these substitutions on.

revealOn.description: When to reveal the original text. Options are -- 'cursor': reveal when a cursor contacts a symbol; 'cursor-inside': reveal when a cursor is inside a symbol; 'active-line': reveal all symbols on the same line as a cursor; 'selection': reveal all symbols that are selected or contact a cursor; 'none': do not reveal.

adjustCursorMovement.description: If enabled, cursor movement will treat 'pretty' symbols as one character instead of stepping through the underlying 'ugly' text (this does not currently cover all situations).

prettyCursor.description: Controls how a 'pretty' symbol is rendered when contacted by a cursor. Options are -- 'boxed': render an outline around the symbol; 'none': no change

combineIdenticalScopes.description: If `true`, combine adjacent tokens if they have the same scope

textMateGrammar.description: Specify the TextMate grammar file used to generate scope information for matching substitutions. If not specified, PSM will attempt to automatically find the grammar file that vscode uses.

textMateInitialScope.description: Override the initial scope used to identify the grammar. If undefined, then the initial scope will be inferred by searching for installed extensions that provide grammars for the current language.

ugly.description: A Javascript regular expression to specify the 'ugly' string to be replaced. For example, '\\\b' matches a word boundary. Remember to escape your strings!! Writing '\b' instead of '\\\b' will denote a backspace instead of a word boundary. To match a literal backslash, you must write '\\\\\\\' because it will be escaped by both JSON and Javascript's RegExp library. You may use non-matching groups, i.e. '(?:...)', but using matching groups, i.e. '(...)', will break substitutions.

pretty.description: The text to replace an 'ugly' string with. You may use fancy unicode symbols and multiple characters.

pre.description: If specified, the text before the 'ugly' text must match this pattern. E.g. '\\\b'

post.description: If specified, the text following the 'ugly' text must match this pattern. E.g. '\\\b'

scope.description: A scope expression: a whitespace-separated list of scope-names. If specified, then the `ugly` regular expression is only checked against individual tokens of matching scopes.

hackCSS.description: Hack: attempt to inject arbitrary CSS; this is unsupported and may cause problems

light.description: Styling options for vscode light themes

hackCSS.description: Hack: attempt to inject arbitrary CSS; this is unsupported and may cause problems

dark.description: Styling options for vscode dark themes

hackCSS.description: Hack: attempt to inject arbitrary CSS; this is unsupported and may cause problems
